02.orig_text: Steve Jobs, founder of Apple, has chosen to step down from his post as CEO of the company.
02.text: Steve Jobs, founder of Apple, has chosen to step down from his post as CEO of the company.

03.orig_text: The former Chief Operating Officer, Tim Cook will be succeeding Jobs as CEO.
03.text: The former Chief Operating Officer, Tim Cook will be succeeding Jobs as CEO.

04.orig_text: Jobs resigned in a letter to Apple's board of directors stating, ``I have always said if there ever came a day when I could no longer meet my duties and expectations as Apple's C.E.O., I would be the first to let you know.
04.text: Jobs resigned in a letter to Apple's board of directors stating, ``I have always said if there ever came a day when I could no longer meet my duties and expectations as Apple's C.E.O., I would be the first to let you know.

06.orig_text: In that same letter, Jobs stated that his desire was to remain as chairman of the board.
06.text: In that same letter, Jobs stated that his desire was to remain as chairman of the board.

07.orig_text: Steve Jobs has been fighting pancreatic cancer since 2004 and has been on medical leave since January of this year.
07.text: Steve Jobs has been fighting pancreatic cancer since 2004 and has been on medical leave since January of this year.

08.orig_text: This was Jobs' third period of medical leave.
08.text: This was Jobs' third period of medical leave.

09.orig_text: He briefly made an appearance in March and June to unveil the iPad 2 and the iCloud, an online cloud computing service.
09.text: He briefly made an appearance in March and June to unveil the iPad 2 and the iCloud, an online cloud computing service.

10.orig_text: In part of his resignation, Jobs left this farewell, ``I have made some of the best friends of my life at Apple, and I thank you all for the many years of being able to work alongside you.``
10.text: In part of his resignation, Jobs left this farewell, ``I have made some of the best friends of my life at Apple, and I thank you all for the many years of being able to work alongside you.``

11.orig_text: Tim Cook was personally recommended by Jobs to take over as CEO and has been serving as interim CEO since the beginning of Jobs' medical leave.
11.text: Tim Cook was personally recommended by Jobs to take over as CEO and has been serving as interim CEO since the beginning of Jobs' medical leave.

12.orig_text: Before his post at Apple, Cook held positions at IBM and Compaq.
12.text: Before his post at Apple, Cook held positions at IBM and Compaq.

13.orig_text: He is known for staying out of the spotlight.
13.text: He is known for staying out of the spotlight.

14.orig_text: Due to an operational overhaul by Cook, he is credited with the success of the iPad and MacBook Air.
14.text: Due to an operational overhaul by Cook, he is credited with the success of the iPad and MacBook Air.

15.orig_text: He also stood in Steve Jobs' place while the CEO underwent liver transplant surgery.
15.text: He also stood in Steve Jobs' place while the CEO underwent liver transplant surgery.

16.orig_text: He received $59 million for his performance in the position.
16.text: He received $59 million for his performance in the position.

17.orig_text: Analyst Charles Golvin predicts that the resignation will not begin to affect Apple performance for 1.5 to 2 years.
17.text: Analyst Charles Golvin predicts that the resignation will not begin to affect Apple performance for 1.5 to 2 years.

18.orig_text: Many of the new products are already under development and Jobs will continue to steer the company from his position as chairman of the board.
18.text: Many of the new products are already under development and Jobs will continue to steer the company from his position as chairman of the board.

19.orig_text: Art Levinson, chairman of Genentech and a member of the board, adds, ``Steve will continue to serve Apple with his unique insights, creativity and inspiration``.
19.text: Art Levinson, chairman of Genentech and a member of the board, adds, ``Steve will continue to serve Apple with his unique insights, creativity and inspiration``.

20.orig_text: A contrary view is offered by Charles O'Reilly, a management expert at Stanford University, who stated, ``Great companies rarely go from strength to strength``.
20.text: A contrary view is offered by Charles O'Reilly, a management expert at Stanford University, who stated, ``Great companies rarely go from strength to strength``.

21.orig_text: Richard Doherty attributes Steve Jobs' success as the ability to hold off on a product until it is perfect.
21.text: Richard Doherty attributes Steve Jobs' success as the ability to hold off on a product until it is perfect.

22.orig_text: He states ``A lot of products could have gotten to market earlier, but he wanted it better.``
22.text: He states ``A lot of products could have gotten to market earlier, but he wanted it better.``

23.orig_text: In light of the revelation, Apple shares (AAPL) slid $19.37 in after hours trading--a drop of over 5%.
23.text: In light of the revelation, Apple shares (AAPL) slid $19.37 in after hours trading--a drop of over 5%.

24.orig_text: Since market open, Apple shares rose to $373.72, a drop of only $2.46 since Wednesday's close.
24.text: Since market open, Apple shares rose to $373.72, a drop of only $2.46 since Wednesday's close.
